description: Construction of 17 no. 3 storey 3 & 4 bedroom houses, and 7 no. 4 storey 5 bedroom houses, most with roof top gardens and access pods, and associated landscaping, amenity space and parking, with proposed vehicular access from Bromyard Avenue (via 41-159 Bromyard Avenue), following demolition of the existing 20 no. 2 storey 3 bedroom houses)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing numbers: (00)_AP_000 P01 Site Location Plan; (00)_AP_100_P08 Proposed Site Plan (Bromyard Avenue Access); (20)_AS_001_P05 Proposed Site Sections (20)_AS_002_P03 Proposed Site Sections; (20)_AP_001_P02 Proposed House Type 01 - Typical Floor Plans; (20)_AP_002_P01 Proposed House Type 02 - Typical Floor Plans; (20)_AP_003_P01 Proposed House Type 03 - Typical Floor Plans; (20)_AP_004_P02 Proposed House Type 04 - Typical Floor Plans; (20)_AP_005_P05 Proposed House Type 05 - Typical Floor Plans; (20)_AP_010_P01 Typical Lifetime Homes Plans; (20)_AE_001_P03 Proposed Elevations House Types 01 & 02; (20)_AE_002_P06 Proposed Elevations House Types 01, 03 & 04; (20)_AE_003_P05 Proposed Elevations House Type 05; D1895L.100 Rev A Colour Masterplan Option 01; D1895L.101 Rev A Colour Masterplan Option 02; and Amenity Schedule  Revision F and Accommodation Schedule Revision D, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: In the interests of proper planning and to ensure that the development is implemented in accordance with the approved plans, which have been, assessed against the Council's adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Samples and/or details of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development (including privacy screens for roof terraces) shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications to these matters which have been given in this application. The development shall be carried out in accordance with the approved details.  Reason: To ensure that the materials are appropriate for the development, to safeguard the character and appearance of the area and to safeguard the privacy of future occupiers, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the approved drawings, details including samples of the proposed obscure glazed windows on the eastern elevation of Unit 24 shall be submitted to the Local Planning Authority for approval prior to the commencement of the development. The windows shall be fitted with obscure glass in accordance with the details shown on the proposed plans prior to the first occupation of Unit 24, and permanently retained for the life of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of neighbouring residential development to the east, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the approved drawings, full details of the design layout of the roof terraces and associated roof pods including mitigation measures to ensure that there is no unacceptable loss of privacy to adjoining properties, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details as approved shall be implemented prior to first occupation of  the subject dwelling and shall be permanently retained for the life of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To safeguard against loss of privacy and overlooking in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 6.7 of the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of proposed hard and soft landscaping works and all boundary treatment to be submitted, prior to first occupation of the development and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include:  - Detailed planting plans indicating plant species and numbers for all landscaped areas, retained trees and details of the proposed roof terraces - Details of hard landscaping, materials and construction specifications  (including tree root protection measures) - Proposed measures to improve biodiversity - 5-year landscape management plan - A plan indicating the positions, design, materials and type of boundary treatment (walls, fences and gates) to be erected  This condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters, which have been given in this application. The approved works and management plan shall be implemented prior to first occupation of any part of the development or in accordance with a programme agreed by the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or other plants which die or are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased within the first five years following the implementation of the landscaping scheme shall be replaced during the next planting season.  Reason: To ensure that the development is landscaped in the interests of the character and appearance of the area and to enhance the biodiversity of the site, in accordance with policies 3.8, 4.1 and 4.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of the proposed children's play areas to be submitted prior to first occupation of the development and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall include play equipment, landscaping, boundary treatment (including any acoustic fencing), disabled access and security measures and the condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application. The approved details shall be implemented as approved prior to first occupation of any of the residential units hereby approved and retained for the life of the development unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that adequate on-site space for children to play is provided on site in connection with the proposed residential accommodation, in accordance with policies 3.5, 4.11 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and policy 3D.13 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2008). | Notwithstanding the Travel Plan contained within the Transport Statement submitted with the planning application, a revised Travel Plan, designed to manage the transport needs of residents and visitors, to minimise car usage and promote alternative modes of transport, shall be submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is occupied. The approved Travel Plan shall be implemented at the time of first occupation of any part of the development and shall be permanently retained in operation for the life of the development unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To promote sustainable patterns of transport, and to limit the impact of the proposal on local parking conditions, in accordance with policies 9.1 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance Note 21 'Sustainable Transport - Green Travel Plans'. | Details of the siting, height and nature of a closed circuit television network (CCTV) for the site shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority prior to its installation and the system shall be installed in accordance with the approved details, prior to the first occupation of any part of the development hereby approved, and thereafter shall not be altered for the life of the development, except with the written permission of the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: To provide adequate security within the site whilst safeguarding the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.4 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Details of any external lighting associated with the development is submitted prior to first occupation of the development and approved by the Local Planning Authority. The details shall be implemented as approved prior to occupation and retained thereafter for the life of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority. Such details shall meet the recommendations of the Institution of Lighting Engineers Guidance Notes for the Reduction of Light Pollution including:  (i) reducing glare by  - Correctly aiming the luminaires - Using luminaires with double asymmetric beams designed so that the front glazing is kept at or near parallel to the surface being lit  - Ensuring that the main beam angle of all lights, directed towards a potential observer is kept below 70 degrees.  (ii)  controlling vertical illuminance with the lights operating to a maximum of 10 lux at ground level and 5 lux at first floor level at any affected facade.  Reason: To safeguard the living conditions of the adjoining occupiers, the character of the area and in the interests of crime prevention and safety, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.4, 4.12 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | No development shall take place until details of a construction logistics plan has been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority. The plan shall include the following:  - Anticipated number, frequency and size of construction vehicles entering/exiting the site - Delivery times  - Proposed on-site construction worker parking - Dust suppression measures - Wheel washing provisions - Site security during construction - On site storage - Tree protection - Construction vehicle manoeuvring and turning, including sweep path diagrams to demonstrate how vehicles will access the site and be able to turn into and emerge from the site in forward gear. - Procedures for on-site contractors to deal with complaints from local residents - Details of any temporary vehicular access  The construction logistics plan shall be implemented on commencement of any works on site and the site shall be managed in accordance with the approved plan for the duration of construction, or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: In the interests of the amenity of adjoining occupiers and to minimise highway and traffic impact during the course of construction, in accordance with policies 2.6, 4.1, 4.11 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards and the 2 proposed wheelchair/wheelchair adaptable residential units shall be provided prior to first occupation.  Such measures shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the development and retained thereafter for the life of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local planning Authority.   Reason: To increase the proportion of dwellings accessible to people with disabilities in line with the borough's needs, in accordance with policies 4.3 and 5.3 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 7 'Accessible Ealing'. | No microwave masts, antennae or satellite dishes or any other plant or equipment shall be installed on any of the buildings hereby permitted unless otherwise approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To safeguard the appearance of the buildings in the interests of visual amenity, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The development shall be implemented in accordance with a revised energy strategy to be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure the proposal contributes to its energy requirements through the implementation of high-energy efficiency measures and sustainable technologies in accordance with policies 4A.1 and 4A.3 of the London Plan (Consolidated 2008), and polices 2.1 and 4.1 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The proposed provision for refuse and recycling storage for the development shall be provided in accordance with the details shown on the approved drawings prior to the first occupation of any part of the development hereby permitted, and shall be retained thereafter for the life of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.   Reason: To protect the living conditions of existing and future occupiers of the area and to safeguard the appearance of the area, in accordance with policies 2.10, 4.1, and 5.5 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 4 'Refuse Storage'. | The tree protection measures detailed within the approved Tree Report shall be implemented in accordance with the approved document to BS5837 2005 standards during the preparation of the site and the demolition and construction of the development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason:  To safeguard the existing trees on the site, in the interests of the character and appearance of the area and the environment, in accordance with policy 4.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance 9 'Trees and Development Guidance'. | The parking spaces and cycle storage areas identified on the approved drawings, shall be marked out/provided on site prior to first occupation of any part of the development, and shall be kept continuously available for life of the development and shall not be used for any other purpose unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate parking provision and vehicle charging facilities within the site, in accordance with policies 2.9, 4.3, 9.1 and 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The roof to house units 12 and 23 as shown on the approved sit plan, drawing numbered (00)_AP_100_P08 shall not be used as a roof terrace or for any form of outdoor amenity space and there shall be no means of access to the roof from within the subject dwellings.  Reason: To safeguard against loss of privacy and overlooking in accordance with policies 4.1, 5.5 and 6.7 of the Council's Adopted Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Part 1 Classes A, B, C, D, E and F of Schedule 2 to the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) Order 1995, as amended, there shall be no enlargement, improvement or other external alterations to the dwellinghouses or additions or alterations to  their roofs, and no construction of a porch or the provison of any building, enclosure or hard surface within the curtilage of the dwellinghouses, including the roof space, without the prior permission of the Local Planning Authority, obtained through the submission of a planning application.  Reason: To prevent the overdevelopment of the site, to safeguard the living conditions of the occupiers of adjoining properties and to protect the character and appearance of the area in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.8 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | Before any part of the development hereby approved is occupied the existing vehicular access to the site from Sir Alexander Road shall be permanently closed, in accordance with details to be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: To ensure that there is adequate parking provision and vehicle charging facilities within the site, in accordance with policies 2.9, 4.3, 9.1 and 9.6 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004).
